executable.title: DTI-Reg
executable.description: DTI-Reg performs pair-wise DTI registration, using FA or MD maps to drive the registration
executable.contributor: Clement Vachet (SCI, University of Utah), Adrien Kaiser (NIRAL, UNC-Chapel Hill), Francois Budin (NIRAL, UNC-Chapel Hill)
executable.acknowledgements: This work is part of the National Alliance for Medical Image Computing (NAMIC), funded by the National Institutes of Health through the NIH Roadmap for Medical Research, Grant U54 EB005149.

image.name: fixedVolume
image.label: Fixed DTI Volume
image.description: Fixed DTI image (or leave this empty and give a scalar image with --scalarFixedVolume)

image.name: scalarFixedVolume
image.label: Scalar Fixed Volume
image.description: Optional: Give a scalar fixed image instead of a fixed DTI volume

transform.name: initialAffine
transform.label: Initial transformation file
transform.description: Filename of transform used to initialize the registration. If BRAINS used, this CAN NOT be used with initializeTransformMode option.

image.name: fixedMaskVolume
image.label: Fixed Mask Volume
image.description: Optional: Fixed binary mask image - used when computing the fixed DTI

image.name: movingMaskVolume
image.label: Moving Mask Volume
image.description: Optional: Moving binary mask image - used when computing the moving DTI

string-enumeration.name: method
string-enumeration.label: Computational method
string-enumeration.description: Use scalar FA or MD map to drive the registration via: Method 1)BRAINS -BRAINSFit/BRAINSDemonWarp- or Method 2)ANTS

string-enumeration.name: scalarMeasurement
string-enumeration.label: Scalar Measurement
string-enumeration.description: Select if DTI-Reg uses the Fractional Anisotropy (FA) or the Mean Diffusivity (MD) map to drive the registration (used with useScalar-BRAINS and useScalar-ANTS)

transform.name: outputTransform
transform.description: With ANTS, this is the affine part of the transform. With BRAINS, this is the initialization transform in case of warping, or a rigid/affine/BSpline transform otherwise. If The initialization is set to Off, it will return the identity transform
transform.label: Output Linear Transform

image.name: outputInverseDeformationFieldVolume
image.description: Output inverse displacement field vector image (only for ANTS)
image.label: Output Inverse Displacement Field Volume

image.name: outputFixedScalarVolume
image.label: Fixed Scalar Measurement (FA or MD) Volume
image.description: Fixed Scalar Measurement (FA or MD) Volume

image.name: outputMovingScalarVolume
image.label: Moving Scalar Measurement (FA or MD) Volume

image.name: outputResampledScalarVolume
image.label: Resampled Scalar Measurement (FA or MD) Volume
image.description: Resampled Scalar Measurement (FA or MD) Volume

string-enumeration.name: BRAINSRegistrationType
string-enumeration.label: BRAINS Registration Type
string-enumeration.description: BRAINS Registration type: Rigid, Affine, BSpline, Diffeomorphic, LogDemons, SymmetricLogDemons

string-enumeration.name: BRAINSinitializeTransformMode
string-enumeration.label: Intitialize Transform Mode
string-enumeration.description: Determine how to initialize the transform center. GeometryAlign on assumes that the center of the voxel lattice of the images represent similar structures. MomentsAlign assumes that the center of mass of the images represent similar structures. useCenterOfHeadAlign attempts to use the top of head and shape of neck to drive a center of mass estimate. Off assumes that the physical space of the images are close, and that centering in terms of the image Origins is a good starting point. This flag is mutually exclusive with the initialTransform flag.
